TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content: http://9gag.com/gag/aW0GwBd

not just a dream anymore zekes my friend i just cant publish it now because time.....when you see the latest fail from NASA and think that they should have not tested that design in KSP

That was the old version... the new one is perfectly indestructable (and unreleased)
When in a important class you doodle rockets and have a notebook with all the formulas and part stats from ksp wiki so that you can build rockets that work...

When in a important class you doodle rockets and have a notebook with all the formulas and part stats from ksp wiki so that you can build rockets that work...

I just did that today XD

When you have managed to convince yourself that if NASA somehow hired you as a pilot that you could easily fly a real rocket into space and dock it with the ISS with no real world training or experience.

...your wife tells you off for not washing they dishes because you were busy making a mun base

...your wife starts referring to herself as a "KSP widow".

When you use RT-10s for stage separations...

Yes, my rocket has got that big!
When the only reason you signed up for Twitter was "To be notified of some unlisted Scott Manley videos"
When you only install (K)ubuntu for 64 bit linux KSP so you can play with as many mods as you like.
When you are watching a KSP video and you are trying to move the camera with your mouse...
...when you aim for Africa to land your real life spacecraft o_O
I think it's roughly in Mozambique actually
You asparagus stage your SRBs (but step down their thrust so they burn at different rates)

...when you drive in the evening rush and worry because you won't get enough horizontal speed out of your air - breathing engine...

... or if you crash a car and search for the 'revert flight' button and panic when it's not there.
when you log over 500 hours according to Steam. I thought Skyrim had me hooked.

when you log over 500 hours according to Steam. I thought Skyrim had me hooked.

I don't pay much attention to that because I have a bad habit of leaving games running in the background...

When you hear that the fuels tanks, decouplers etc... cost a lot in a rocket, you wonder: "wait, if it cost so much, why don't they mod the engines to give it a lot of thrust and a extremely hight Isp???"

Bonus point if you call NASA to tell them your idea about modding engines.

When you are watching a KSP video and you are trying to move the camera with your mouse...

I am happy knowing I'm not alone in this.
When you see a barn and get really excited.
When you've spent 1 1/2 weeks of 2014 JUST playing KSP.
You take a day off work because KSP just updated to the next version...

..when you can't enjoy interstellar.. deorbiting station because explosion, burning up to safe it..

worst of all fudging bathroom tiles in the stasis lab... FUUUUUU!

When you talk to your best friend, who has absolutely no intrest in space whatsoever, about getting KSP for a youtube channel of all his gaming fails that he has just made, because "All of the rocket parts act like soild nitroglycerin. Forget struts? It blows up in your face. Not enough fuel? Your crew either: 1. Dies in the cold depths of space. 2. Chrashes into surface of planet/ mun you are landing on or 3. They die stranded on the said celestial body, because you couldn't take off because you knew you would not get back into orbit. Look at it the wrong way? Kracken attacks it. I then had to waste the entire lunch explaining about the Kracken and orbital mechanics.

When you are watching a KSP video and you are trying to move the camera with your mouse...

When you play Xcom and your first move every mission is to run a random soldier to a random square because you try to move the camera with your mouse
When your installation of KSP uses 11 gigs of RAM
